provisions of this applicable state statute shall be guilty of a misdemeanor any employee of the dispensary violating any provision of this applicable state statute shall be subject to discipline 72181   12151987 20508  examination of books and records the council and any officer or officers formally authorized by it shall have the power to make investigations into the municipal liquor dispensarys affairs subpoena witnesses administer oaths and compel the production of books and papers the council may at any time provide for an examination or audit of the accounts of the municipal liquor dispensary at the beginning of each fiscal year the council shall employ either a certified public accountant or the state public examiner to audit all accounts of the municipal liquor dispensary for the preceding fiscal year such auditor so employed shall have unlimited privileges of investigation to examine under oath or otherwise all officers clerks and employees of the municipal liquor dispensary who shall give all required information and assistance and who shall submit for examination all such books and papers relating to the business of the municipal liquor dispensary as is requested any city official or employee failing to respond appropriately to a reasonable request of the auditor shall be subject to discipline a duplicate report of any such audit shall be presented to the mayor and each council member one copy shall be filed with the city manager and one copy shall be filed with the manager of the dispensary the council shall provide for the payment of each such audit 72181   12151987 chapter 206  public improvement procedures 20601  procedures established unless specifically undertaken pursuant to minn stats ch 429 the following provisions shall govern control and provide the method of making local improvements and special assessments in the city 20602  classification and costs all public and local improvements shall be divided into three classes as following a class a improvements which are of general benefit to the city as a whole the cost of which shall be paid out of city funds b class b improvements which are both of general benefit and which also directly benefit abutting property the cost of which shall be paid out of city funds and by special assessments against the property benefited in proportion to the benefit received as determined by the city council c class c improvements which are expressly for the benefit of adjacent property the cost of which shall be paid entirely by special assessments against the property found to benefit thereby or abut thereto 20603  initiation the proceedings to be followed in making all public and local improvements shall be initiated either by a resolution adopted by the council or by a request petition signed by owners of not less than 35 percent of the real property abutting on the street or streets or within the area named in the petition as the location of the petitioned improvement the council shall by resolution declare the adequacy of such petition and signatures thereto the terms improvement or project may be taken to mean any kind of construction property material equipment alteration maintenance service or any combination thereof several improvements may be included in one project and in the same proceedings 20604  preliminary plans at its meeting at which said proceedings are initiated the council shall direct the citys engineer to prepare preliminary plans for and a description of the nature and location of the improvement together with an estimate of its cost and an assessment basis all of which shall be filed with the city manager without delay 20605  public hearing after initiation of improvement proceedings and receipt of the city engineers report the council shall arrange for a public hearing to consider said improvements preliminary plans and cost estimates must be on file with the city manager at least seven days before said hearing a notice of said hearing outlining the nature and general location of the improvement stating that the preliminary plans and cost estimates may be seen at the city managers office and stating that all citizens interested in the improvement will be heard at the public hearing at the time and place therein designated shall be published once in the official newspaper of the city at least seven days before the hearing a copy of said notice also shall be mailed to each owner of property to be assessed for the cost of any part of said improvement at least seven days prior to said hearing as such ownership is shown in records of the hennepin county auditor 20606  hearing procedure at the public hearing on an improvement business shall be taken up in the following order a reading a description and cost estimates of the proposed improvement b designating and classifying said improvement and determining district boundaries within which property may be assessed for the cost of the improvement c hearing of interested citizens d amending approving or rejecting said improvement by motion of the council e if the improvement is approved authorizing by resolution the making of said improvement and directing the city engineer or a specially appointed engineer to prepare complete working plans specifications and detailed cost estimates of said improvement reasonable opportunity shall be given all citizens to be heard on any matter relative to the proceedings on said improvement if practicable the hearing shall be completed in one session  otherwise the meeting may be adjourned to a stated time and as many adjourned sessions as may seem expedient in case the proposed project is amended by extension so that it will directly affect property the owners of which have not been served a notice of the hearing as provided in the hearing shall be adjourned for not less than ten days nor more than 21 days and notice thereof together with the original hearing notice shall be served on said property owners said service as to manner and time shall be as specified in an adjourned session shall be conducted in the same manner as stated above 20607  supplemental petitions in the event improvement proceedings have been initiated by a petition on which the council does not take favorable action at the hearing specified in said hearing shall be adjourned to a time not less than 21 days nor more than 30 days from the date thereof and copies of the preliminary plans cost estimates and assessment basis together with petition forms shall be given out for circulation and signatures at or after the hearing on request of the original petitioners these petitions herein termed supplemental petitions shall give a legal description of the property owned by each signer and each signature shall be duly acknowledged said supplemental petitions shall be filed with the city manager within 30 days after said hearing thereupon the city manager shall compare the names of signers and property descriptions with the county auditors records and if he finds that said supplemental petitions have been signed by owners of at least 51 percent of abutting property to be directly affected by said improvement he shall refer said petitions to the council at said adjourned meeting whereupon the council shall authorize said improvement and proceed with construction as herein provided 20608  bids and award of contract if the filed estimate of an improvement is $250000 or more the council shall on approval of the plans and specifications for said improvement advertise for sealed bids in the official newspaper of the city and in such other publications as it may decide giving not less than ten days notice of the meeting of the council to open and consider bids unless the council by an emergency ordinance shall provide otherwise each bid shall be accompanied by cash or a certified check or bidders bond in such an amount as the council may specify as a guarantee that the successful bidder will enter into a contract satisfactory to the council bids may be opened and a contract awarded at a regular an adjourned or a special meeting of the council the consideration of bids and awarding of a contract shall comply with the provisions of of the revised city charter the whole project may be covered by one contract or different parts may be covered by separate contracts unless the improvement is an emergency measure the council shall not award a contract at a cost price which exceeds the engineers detailed estimate by more than 25 percent without first readvertising and accepting new bids acting under express permission of the council secured prior to the award of the contract as above specified property owners may make local improvements in front of their respective properties such as sidewalks curbs gutters branch sewers and tree planting provided the work is done within the time specified by the council according to plans and specifications furnished by the city and under the supervision of the city engineer or other inspection authorized by the council in preparation for a contemplated improvement such as street oiling or pavement the council may require property owners to make local improvements in front of their respective properties such as watermain connections curbs gutters and branch sewers by so notifying said owners thirty days before said local improvements are to be completed  the serving of said notice to be the same as specified in in case any property owner fails to comply with said notice the council may cause said local improvements to be made and may assess the cost thereof on the benefited property 20609  contract provisions every contract for an improvement shall specify a that the contractor shall be responsible for the condition of the project until its acceptance by the council  b that the contractor shall save the city harmless from all defective materials or insufficiency of labor or materials and from all claims for damages resulting directly or indirectly under his contract  c that the contractor shall be paid monthly on the basis of 90 percent of the acceptable construction completed during the preceding month plus 90 percent of the acceptable delivered unused materials according to the certificate of the city engineer or other engineer specially appointed  d that final payment shall not be made until the improvement covered by the contract has been completed its operation has been tested and it has been accepted by the council  e that the plans and specifications are parts of the contract  and f that in case the contractor fails to fully comply with the contract requirements the council may order the work suspended and either relet the contract or have the work completed by city labor every contract shall be accompanied by an acceptable surety bond in the full amount of the contract price conditioned on full compliance with and completion of the contract acceptable to the council and for the payment of all materials used and labor performed the contract also may provide that the contractors bond shall further be conditioned on replacing all defective workmanship and material and making good all defects and omissions which may be detected within two years after the completion of the contract and to pay the city for all damages resulting from such defects omissions and all acts of the contractor under the contract  g that the engineer under the contract shall be paid in full only after he furnishes the city manager with complete as built plans showing the contract improvements as existing 20610  inspection when public improvements are under construction the citys engineer shall make frequent inspections of all work in progress and shall make tests of the materials used he shall report to the council promptly any deviation from the contract or any faulty material or workmanship which comes to his attention if a maintenance bond is required under f he also shall inspect the work during the two years following completion of the contract and particularly just before the maintenance bond expires and he shall report to the council any defect which gives the city the right of action under the maintenance bond 20611  confirmation of the assessment at any time after the public hearing authorized in hereof and after the authorization of an improvement the city manager shall prepare and file a complete assessment roll assessing the cost of each improvement separately property abutting upon an improvement shall be assessed at a uniform rate per front foot an area basis andor an equal amount per lot whichever is most equitable if the benefits are also spread over an area outside of abutting property the additional assessment shall be levied on a uniform area basis on all nonabutting property provided that under exceptional conditions whereby the assessment on any property would be equitable if computed according to either the front or the area basis said assessments may be adjusted in proportion to the benefits accruing to such property the costs of an improvement or specific parts of an improvement common to more than one assessment district may be apportioned over two or more such districts as indirect benefits upon the filing of the assessment roll the city manager shall mail a notice of a public hearing thereon to each owner of property to be assessed for the cost of any part of the improvement at least seven days prior to said hearing as such ownership is shown in records of the hennepin county auditor said notice shall state that the assessment roll is open for public inspection in the city managers office and the place date and hour of said hearing whereat the council will consider the assessments and will hear all interested persons at said hearing the assessment roll shall be read in full the council shall hear all interested persons and may amend the assessments finally either at the first or an adjourned session of said hearing the council shall confirm the completed assessment roll by resolution 20612  reassessment and refunds on the completion of any improvement the cost of which has been assessed on abutting andor benefited property and the final cost of the project including engineering inspection and other incidental expenses has been determined the council may reassess any additional costs not yet assessed on abutting andor the benefited property in the same manner and on the same basis as the original assessment and such reassessment amounts shall be added thereto if the assessment exceeds the actual cost of the improvement the city council shall by resolution provide for a prorata refund of such assessment to the persons who are by law entitled to the same by a proper correction of the assessment roll certified to the county auditor or otherwise or by direct payment with city warrants of the amounts of the adjustment if the assessment has been made 20613  appeals any person who may deem that there is any irregularity in the proceedings for an improvement or who is dissatisfied with the amount assessed against his property may at any time within 20 days after the passage of the resolution confirming the assessment appeal from such action to the district court of hennepin county by serving upon the mayor a notice setting forth the grounds of appeal which notice with proof of service shall be filed with the city manager forthwith the appellant shall file with the city manager for the benefit of the city a bond in the sum approved by the city manager conditioned to pay all costs and disbursements which may be awarded against him and abide the order of the court appellant shall file certified copies of the notice of appeal and bond on appeal together with all endorsements with the clerk of the district court within ten days after the service of said notice of appeal upon the filing of such certified copies with the clerk of the district court the city manager shall furnish the appellant with certified copies of such records as may be necessary to present the appeal on payment by the appellant of the city managers proper charges thereof the appeal shall be entered by the clerk of said court upon the civil calendar for trial at the next term of said court commencing not less than ten days after serving the notice of appeal in case the judgment is adverse to the city the council shall have the power to levy a corrected assessment against the property of an appellant in accordance therewith assessments shall be conclusive as against any and all persons who do make such appeal 20614  collection of assessments the council shall provide for the collection of assessments in annual installments over a period of not to exceed 20 years provided that all assessments for improvements of a temporary character shall be levied and collected in a lump sum the whole of any such assessment may be paid to the city without interest if paid within 30 days from the date of passage of the resolution confirming the assessment when payment of any assessment is deferred interest shall be charged annually on the unpaid balance at a rate not to exceed that permitted by state law from the date of the passage of the resolution confirming the assessment and such assessment shall be a lien upon the premises benefited until paid it shall be the duty of the city manager annually at the time of certifying other taxes to certify to the county auditor all special assessments due from property in the current year and previous years with interest on all unpaid installments which sums shall be extended on the tax rolls against such property in the same manner as other taxes are collected by the county treasurer and paid to the city as other taxes are collected and paid 20615  financing in compliance with the revised city charter the council may at the time of passing the resolution approving any improvement or at any time subsequent thereto provide for the issuance of certificates of indebtedness or bonds of the city sufficient to pay the cost of constructing and installing said improvement the council may for the purpose of creating a working capital for such construction also issue temporary certificates of indebtedness all certificates of indebtedness or bonds of the city shall mature serially in annual installments within not more than 20 years after issue and if so specified at the time of sale such certificates or bonds may be made payable on call of the city no annual maturing installment of principal shall be more than 212 times the amount of the smallest installment thereof maturing in any one year 20616  irregularities no error or irregularity which does not materially affect the rights of property owners affected shall invalidate these proceedings or any assessment levied under this  unclaimed property 20701  custody the city return such property to said owner 72181   12231997 20702  disposition all property held in custody by the city and remaining unclaimed after 60 days shall be deemed abandoned and together with any greenlawn and old wayzata cemeteries have been established and hereby are continued upon property of the city all premises constituting these cemeteries shall be subject to the rules and regulations herein adopted for their use and maintenance a map of the summit park cemetery as drawn by charles h ramsdell landscape architect is on file in the office of the city manager and with the register of deeds of hennepin county and said map hereby is adopted as the official map of said cemetery 31202  interment privileges the city manager is hereby authorized to grant interment privileges in lots in any city cemetery to persons paying the price therefor established by the city council any person paying the price thus fixed shall be entitled to a burial easement executed by the mayor and the city manager upon obtaining an interment permit such a purchaser shall have the right to bury a person having residence in the city at the time of death a person who at the time of death was a relative of a resident of the city or a person who was a relative of one already interned in the cemetery the burial easement shall expressly require the holder to observe all rules and regulations adopted from time to time relative to use of the cemetery the burial easement shall provide that the privilege of interment is inalienable the city manager hereby is authorized to repurchase the unused portions of any burial lot at a price not to exceed the original purchase price paid to the city therefor every deceased person buried in the cemetery shall be placed in a concrete or steel outside container and the funeral director handling interment shall be responsible for placing and closing all such containers 31203  cemetery fund all money received for the sale of burial easements the digging of graves and other services of the cemetery shall be paid directly to the city no burial easement to any cemetery lot shall be issued nor shall any services be performed in or about the cemetery until payment to the city therefor has been made all money received from the sale of burial easements and for the performance of services in or about the cemetery shall be placed in a cemetery fund which monies shall be used for the purchase of cemetery grounds and for maintenance and improvements thereto but for no other purpose whatsoever 31204  duties of sexton the city manager shall have control and management of the city cemeteries and of the maintenance and improvement of the cemetery grounds he shall have such powers and duties relative thereto as are prescribed by law or this he may designate an employee of the city as sexton of the cemeteries the sexton shall have the following duties a he shall keep the grounds walks and streets in order and free from obstructions b he shall have charge of all interments made in the cemetery and he shall hire and supervise all labor used therein c he shall enforce the provisions of this of all regulations adopted by the city council for the government of the cemetery for that purpose he shall be qualified to act in the capacity of a peace officer and to make arrests for the violation of any ordinance or cemetery regulations d he shall require the exhibition to him of a properly executed burial permit before allowing any interment to take place in the cemetery e he shall have charge of the digging of all graves in the cemetery and he shall charge such fees therefor as the city council from time to time shall determine f he shall keep a complete record of the ownership of all burial easements in the cemetery for this purpose it shall be the duty of every purchaser of a burial easement to exhibit to the city manager the original conveyance by which he claims the privilege of burial in any lot g he shall keep a record of all interments in the cemetery showing the exact location of every grave the name sex age time place and cause of death of the person buried therein and the date of burial h he shall prevent any burial in any lot until the city shall have been paid for the burial easement he also shall prevent the interment of any body in any lot without the consent of the person recorded as owner of said burial easement in his records and he may require the consent to be in writing i he shall keep the cemetery open during such times as the city council from time to time shall determine 31205  monuments all monuments and markers placed in the cemetery shall be of bronze granite or marble all foundations for monuments or other structures shall be of sufficient depth and stability to support the proposed structure no monuments markers or other such structures may be erected until the foundation therefor has been approved by the city manager or the sexton of the cemetery the city manager or sexton also shall approve the location of any monument on a grave before its installation no monument shall be allowed in d of the summit park cemetery which sections shall be reserved for markers only 31206  ground improvements no owner of a burial easement shall be allowed to plant any trees shrubs or plants thereon which shall not be interpreted as preventing or prohibiting the placement of removable potted plants the city manager or sexton shall have the right to enter upon any lot and to remove any planting which is deemed detrimental to the cemetery or unsightly or inconvenient to the public no owner of a burial easement shall change the grade of any lot or interfere with the general plan for lot arrangement within the cemetery no fences shall be permitted in the cemetery other than those erected by the city 31207  ground regulations the following regulations shall govern the use of all city cemeteries a no person shall discharge any firearm or have possession of any firearm within the cemetery grounds without the written permission of the city manager except in the case of military funerals and on memorial day b no grave shall be opened except by order of the husband wife father mother son or daughter of the deceased and then only for good cause the city reserving the right to refuse any such request this provision shall not apply when disinterment is ordered by a duly authorized public official c no person shall remove any object from any place in the cemetery or make any excavation therein without the consent of the sexton d all rubbish unsightly material or debris accumulating from any work or other cause shall be removed at once by the person or persons causing its accumulation all derricks and tools also shall be removed at once and the grounds shall be left in as good condition as found e no person shall obstruct any drive or path in the cemetery or in any way injure deface or destroy any stone structure grave flower tree shrub vine or other thing in the cemetery f if any object or structure or any part thereof within the cemetery shall be deemed to be objectionable or to have become objectionable or unsightly the sexton shall have the right to remove the same g no person shall drive any vehicle faster than a walk within the cemetery nor drive over any path or roadway where prohibited by the sexton h no person shall disturb the quiet of the cemetery by noise of any kind or by any improper conduct i no person shall enter or leave the cemetery except at the gates thereof j no person shall use the cemetery grounds or any road therein as a public thoroughfare nor drive any vehicle cemetery except for the purpose of making deliveries in the cemetery k no child shall be permitted within the cemetery unless in the custody and control of an adult l no person shall allow his or her dog to run at large in the cemetery m no person shall loiter in or on the walks drives or lots in the cemetery and any person found within the cemetery shall have a good and sufficient reason for his presence therein n no person shall leave unattended or unfastened any horse or other animal in the cemetery chapter 313  luce line trail 31301 b riparian owner shall mean the owner or owners of record of any property located on the shore of any natural body of water and particularly lake minnetonka and it shall include the immediate family members of such owner or owners c riparian area shall mean that area in any natural body of water adjacent to a riparian owners property and extended into the public waters to the point of navigation by the public d harbor limits the harbor limits of the city shall commence at the line of the shore of any lake or other body of water in or adjacent to the city and extend in on and over the navigable waters of such body of water to the harbor limits of any adjoining municipality or other governmental unit the harbor limits of the city shall be deemed not to extend beyond the point half way between the shores of the body of water over which the city has jurisdiction and the shores of the body of water located in another city or governmental unit 31402  prohibited buoys no person chapter 409  land disturbance 40901  purpose the purpose of this to safeguard life limb property public welfare and the environment by regulating land disturbing activities and controlling erosion and sedimentation within the city 2222005 40902  scope this forth rules and regulations to control land disturbing activities erosion and sedimentation  establishes the requirements and administrative procedures for issuance of permits  provides for review of plans and inspection of land disturbing activities  and provides procedures for enforcement of noncompliance 2222005 40903  definitions for the purposes of this definitions listed hereunder shall be construed as specified in this section a applicant is any person or group that applies for a permit to allow land disturbing activities applicant also means that persons agents employees and others acting under this persons or groups direction the term applicant also refers to the permit holder or holders and the permit holders agents employees and others acting under this persons or groups direction b approval shall mean the proposed work or completed work conforms to this the opinion of the city c asgraded is the extent of surface conditions on completion of grading d bedrock is inplace solid rock e bench is a relatively level step excavated into earth material on which fill is to be placed f borrow is earth material acquired from an offsite location for use in grading on a site g city is the administrative staff or its agent of the city of wayzata h city council is the elected governing board of the city of wayzata i civil engineer is a professional engineer licensed by the minnesota board of architecture engineering land surveying landscape architecture geoscience and interior design to practice in the field of civil engineering j civil engineering is the application of the knowledge of the forces of nature principles of mechanics and the properties of materials to the evaluation design and construction of civil works for the beneficial uses of mankind k common plan of development of sale is contiguous area where multiple separate and distinct land disturbing activities may be taking place at different times or on different schedules but under one proposed plan including but not limited to mass site grading utility installation street construction and home or building construction this item is broadly defined to include design permit application advertisement or physical demarcation indicating that land disturbing activities may occur l compaction is the densification of a soil by removal of air which requires mechanical energy m discharge is the release conveyance channeling runoff or drainage of stormwater including snowmelt and dewatering water from a site n earth material is any rock natural soil or fill andor any combination thereof o engineering geologist is a geologist experienced and knowledgeable in engineering geology p engineering geology is the application of geologic knowledge and principles in the investigation and evaluation of naturally occurring rock and soil for use in the design of civil works q erosion is the wearing away of the ground surface as a result of the movement of wind water andor ice r erosion control refers to methods employed to prevent erosion examples include soil stabilization practices horizontal slope grading temporary or permanent cover and construction phasing s excavation is the mechanical removal of earth material t fill is a deposit of earth material placed by artificial means u final stabilization means that all soil disturbing activities on the site or common plan of development or sale have been completed and that a uniform evenly distributed eg without large bare areas perennial vegetative cover with a density of at least 80 percent of the cover for unpaved areas and areas not covered by permanent structures has been established or equivalent permanent stabilization measures have been employed and that all temporary erosion control devises are removed including silt fence temporary sedimentation basins and temporary standpipes simply sowing grass seed andor mulch is not considered final stabilization final stabilization of a common plan of development or sale includes completion of building or home construction along with final restoration of all yards and adjacent drainage ways v geotechnical engineer is a professional engineer licensed by the minnesota board of architecture engineering land surveying landscape architecture geoscience and interior design to practice in the field of geotechnical engineering w geotechnical engineering is the application of the principles of soils mechanics in the investigation evaluation and design of civil works involving the use of earth materials and the inspection andor testing of the construction thereof x grade is the vertical location of the ground surface y existing grade is the grade prior to grading or land disturbing activities z rough grade is the stage at which the grade approximately conforms to the approved plan aa finish grade is the final grade of the site within 02 feet that conforms to the approved plan bb grading is any excavating or filling or combination thereof cc hydric soils are soils that are saturated flooded or ponded long enough during the growing season to develop anaerobic conditions in the upper layers dd hydrophytic vegetation is macrophytic large enough to be observed by the naked eye plant life growing in water soil or on a substrate that is at least periodically deficient in oxygen as a result of excessive water content ee land disturbance activity is any land change that may result in soil erosion from water or wind and the movement of sediments into or upon waters or lands within of the city of wayzatas jurisdiction including construction clearing and grubbing grading excavating transporting and filling of land ff land disturbance plan and implementation requirements are the plan and requirements prepared by and available from the city engineer implementing the provisions of this permanent controls are longterm methods employed to prevent erosion and sedimentation examples of such protection are swales ponds sediment basins turf reinforcement mats storm sewer systems and riprap hh permanent cover means final stabilization examples include grass gravel asphalt and concrete see also the definition of final stabilization ii permit is a written warrant or license granted for land disturbing activities jj sediment is the product of an erosion process  solid material both mineral and organic that is in suspension is being transported or has been moved by water wind or ice and has come to rest on the earths surface either above or below water level kk sedimentation is the process or action of depositing sediment ll sediment control is the methods employed to prevent sediment from leaving a site examples of sediment control practices are silt fences sediment traps earth dikes drainage swales check dams subsurface drains pipe slope drains storm drain inlet protection and temporary or permanent sedimentation basins mm site is any lot or parcel of land or contiguous combination thereof under the same ownership where a land disturbing activity is performed or permitted nn slope is an inclined ground surface the inclination of which is expressed as a ratio of horizontal distance to vertical distance oo soil is naturally occurring superficial deposits overlying bedrock pp stabilized shall mean the exposed ground surface after it has been covered by perennial vegetation sod erosion control blanket riprap pavement or other material that prevents erosion simply sowing grass seed is not considered stabilization qq stormwater as defined under minn r  subpart 41b stormwater means precipitation runoff stormwater runoff snow melt runoff and any other surface runoff and drainage rr stormwater pollution prevention plan is a joint stormwater and erosion and sediment control plan that is a document containing the requirements of this the city of wayzata land disturbance plan and implementation requirements that when implemented will decrease soil erosion on a parcel of land and offsite nonpoint pollution it involves both temporary and permanent controls ss temporary controls are shortterm methods employed to prevent erosion and sedimentation examples of such protection are silt fence temporary sediment basins check dams straw mulch erosion control blankets wood chips and erosion netting tt terrace is a relatively level step constructed in the face of a graded slope surface for drainage and maintenance purposes uu wetlands as defined in minn r  subpart f are those areas that are inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater at a frequency and duration sufficient to support and that under normal circumstances do support a prevalence of vegetation typically adapted for life in saturated soil conditions wetlands generally include swamps marshes bogs and similar areas constructed wetlands designed for wastewater treatment are not waters of the state wetlands must have the following attributes 1 a predominance of hydric soils  2 inundated or saturated by surface water or groundwater at a frequency and duration sufficient to support a prevalence of hydrophytic vegetation typically adapted for life in a saturated soil condition  and 3 under normal circumstances support a prevalence of such vegetation 2222005 40904  general conformance the owner of a site or common plan of development or sale shall be responsible for maintaining any land disturbing activity in such a way as not to create a hazard to life and limb  or endanger the environment  or endanger property  or adversely affect the safety use or stability of a property public way or drainage channel  or deposit sediment on or into adjacent properties rightofways drainage systems or wetlands until final stabilization as defined in section 40903 has been achieved whenever the city determines that any land disturbing activity has become a hazard to life and limb  or endangers the environment  or endangers property  or adversely affects the safety use or stability of a property public way or drainage channel  or deposits sediment on or into adjacent properties rightofways drainage systems or wetlands the owner of the property upon which the land disturbance activity is located or other person or agent in control of said property upon terrain with a slope flatter than three horizontal to one vertical or is less than three feet in depth not intended to support structures types of activities which may meet these requirements include minor landscaping and the installation and maintenance of home gardens fences signs and mailboxes b an excavation below finished grade for basements and footings of a building retaining wall or other structure authorized by a valid building permit this shall not exempt the requirement for a permit for a land disturbing activity resulting from the material from such excavation nor exempt any silvicultural forestry crops this shall not exempt these types of activities from the other permit requirements set forth by city exploratory excavations and borings under the direction of
